sense.name: voluntarily surrender possession or right
sense.commentary: Note: Includes physical and abstract uses
sense.examples: For ethical reasons, he had relinquished his claim to compensation. The Chamber then relinquished jurisdiction to the plenary court. He relinquished his possession of the controlled substance.

sense.name: give in, fall under the control of another
sense.examples: After listening to his wife go on and on about a new car, he finally relinquished. Although the guy was nasty about it he finally relinquished and lowered the price. The moment she relinquished and signed the document, he left.

sense.name: forego, do without
sense.examples: We must relinquish the old ideas. Wait, you are asking me to relinquish chocolate? Never! If you are willing to relinquish the luxury of a five-minute walk to the beach, you can find affordable housing. Could all those who relinquish women, wealth and wine turn out to be great ascetics?

sense.name: let go, release, as from a grip
sense.examples: Relinquish your grip on the rope, you won't fall! Once you relinquish the door latch, your tow bar unbinds.
